‘Fifty Shades Freed’ Ends Sex Trilogy With Solid Ticket Sales
By BROOKS BARNES FEB. 11, 2018

LOS ANGELES — In one of the more awkward box office pairings in memory, the rough-sex sequel “Fifty Shades Freed” was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, while the cuddly-cute “Peter Rabbit” did well with children in second place.

“Fifty Shades Freed” (Universal Pictures), which did not delight critics nearly as much as it did pun-enthralled headline writers, arrived to ticket sales of roughly $38.8 million. Based on the third and final book in the “Fifty Shades” series by E.L. James, “Fifty Shades Freed” cost an estimated $55 million to make, not including marketing. It was directed by James Foley (“Glengarry Glen Ross”) and co-stars Dakota Johnson and Jamie Dornan.

The “Fifty Shades” cultural fever ended a long time ago: Most readers discovered that a little of Ms. James’s writing goes a long way. But ticket sales for the final movie adaptation — marketed by Universal with a baldfaced tagline, “Don’t miss the climax” — were solid, declining only 16 percent from initial results for its series predecessor, “Fifty Shades Darker,” a year ago.

“Fifty Shades of Grey” kicked off the trilogy in 2015 with X-rated toy tie-ins and $85 million in opening-weekend ticket sales, an astounding total for an erotic drama, a genre that had long been out of favor at multiplexes. All told, the sadomasochistic series has collected roughly $1.1 billion at the worldwide box office, including $98.1 million in international ticket sales over the weekend for “Fifty Shades Freed.”

.

Clint Eastwood had a tougher weekend with “The 15:17 to Paris.” A reconstruction of the 2015 effort by Ayoub el Khazzani to kill passengers on board a European train — thwarted by vacationing American servicemen — “The 15:17 to Paris” collected about $12.6 million, Mr. Eastwood’s lowest wide-release opening result since “J. Edgar” in 2011.

Poor reviews and the absence of marketable stars (the servicemen starred as themselves) likely hurt the film, which cost Warner Bros. and Village Roadshow a modest $30 million to make. About 60 percent of ticket buyers were over the age of 50, Warner said.

巴黎列車上的美軍英雄

2018年02月11日 19:51 中時電子報 江飛宇
導演克林．伊斯威德（Clint Eastwood）近年喜歡翻拍有真實故事為背景的電影，他的新作品「1517巴黎列車」(The 15:17 to Paris)也不例外，只是這一次，電影中的3名主角並不另外找演員飾演，就是由本人直接擔綱演出。

美國國防部生活(dodlive.mil)介紹，2015年8月21日，一列從阿姆斯特丹前往巴黎的列車，遇到摩洛哥籍的恐怖份子阿由卜-伊爾．卡沙尼(Ayoub El Kahzani)持槍自動步槍挾持，卻被車上見義勇為的旅客合力制伏的故事，其中3名與恐怖份子搏鬥，並且搶救傷者的是3名美國遊客，分別是史賓塞．史東(Spencer Stone)、亞歷克．史卡拉托斯(Aleksander Skarlatos)和安東尼．薩德勒(Anthony Sadler)，而電影也是以他們3人為視角。

這部電影是從3名好友的童年說起，他們不是在師長眼中的好學生，他們上課比較不專心，不拘小節，所以老是被誤會成問題孩子，然而他們的個性都相當正面積極，並沒有走入岐途，而且總希望能夠幫助人。其中史東與亞歷克決定從軍，史東是美國空軍士兵，而亞歷克隷屬陸軍國民警衛隊，所以他們2人既是這部電影的主角，也是幕後的軍事顧問，呈現了受訓時期的細節與派駐阿富汗作戰的種種，美國國防部也盡可能提供資源，以表現更多準確性。

史東在制伏恐怖份子的過程中受了不少傷，幸而傷勢不致命，而亞歷克與史賓塞從旁支援，事後成功的壓制恐怖份子。事後法國總統歐蘭德親自頒發「榮譽軍團勳章」(Legion of Honour)給3人，這是法國政府給傑出貢獻的人物給予的最高榮譽。除此之外，史東得到空軍人勳章(Airman's Medal)和因作戰受傷的紫心勳章(Purple Heart)，亞歷克得到陸軍士兵勳章(Soldier's Medal)。

美國軍方對於電影最終的呈現感到很滿意，空軍娛樂聯絡處副主任 黛芙麗．華生(Develyn Watson)說：「這部電影表現了平凡人做出非凡行動的時刻，他們在關鍵時刻挺身而出，挽救了數百人的生命。」

史卡拉托斯則是在火車襲擊案的前一個月，自願留營2年，在2017年退伍。史東則是在火車襲擊案的2個月後，遇到另一起流血事件，他在2015年的10月8日於加州沙加緬度市中心被一名叫做詹姆斯．崔(james Tran)的男子刺傷多處，幾乎危急生命，幸而被搶救了回來，事後繼續在空軍擔任軍士長，直到2016年，他才光榮退伍。詹姆斯崔被判決有罪，有期徒刑9年。

(中時電子報)
